profile.name: Abdelhaq Kharrou
profile.headline: Data Scientist & Cloud Engineer | ML Specialist
profile.bio: Former Telecom Engineer engaged in Data Science & Machine Learning. 10+ years of IT experience bridging the gap between telecom infrastructure and modern cloud AI. Passionate about low-cost, privacy-conscious AI solutions. Currently contributing to open-source AI projects (Omdena) and finalizing the ALX Data Science program.

achievements: Engineered Healthy Eating Index (HEI) features from NHANES data using USDA databases.
Developed reusable Python packages for predictive modeling.
Processed burnt area satellite data using 'firedpy' for Forest Fire early warning systems in India.
Deployed Serverless PWA for Euromove (France) using AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, and ReactJS, cutting paper costs by 70%.
Implemented ERP/CRM (Dolibarr) solutions for multiple local businesses, saving 100% on recurring license fees.
Automated business operations saving clients 10–20 hours weekly.
Managed HLR/HSS infrastructure for 22 million subscribers.
Monitored KPIs and deployed Linux-based server boards for capacity scaling.
Conducted integration testing with Intelligent Networks (IN) ensuring 99.9% service continuity.
Oversaw construction and electrification of telecom sites for INWI.
Acted as client liaison during progress reviews.

education.details: Intensive 18-month curriculum covering Python, Machine Learning, SQL, and AWS Cloud.
Foundational engineering degree in Networks and Telecommunications systems.

projects.title: Scones Unlimited: ML Workflow on AWS
projects.description: Designed a scalable image classification architecture on AWS SageMaker to distinguish delivery vehicles (bicycles vs motorcycles). Orchestrated the entire ML pipeline—from training to deployment—using AWS Step Functions and Lambda to create an event-driven, production-ready system with drift monitoring.

projects.title: Landmark Classification & Tagging
projects.description: Built a robust landmark recognition system for social media tagging. Implemented a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) from scratch and leveraged Transfer Learning (ResNet/VGG) to classify landmark images with high precision, optimizing for real-world class imbalance.

projects.title: MNIST Digit Classifier
projects.description: Developed a high-accuracy handwritten digit recognition model using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) with PyTorch. Optimized network architecture and hyperparameters to achieve >99% accuracy on the standard MNIST dataset.

projects.title: Flower Image Classifier CLI
projects.description: Built a production-style Command Line Interface (CLI) application for image classification. Implemented Transfer Learning (VGG16) in PyTorch to train models on flower datasets with GPU support. Features include modular design (train.py/predict.py), custom hyperparameter tuning, model checkpointing, and real-time inference.

projects.title: Dog Breed Image Classifier
projects.description: A Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) built with PyTorch and Transfer Learning to identify dog breeds from images. Achieved >80% accuracy using ResNet50 architecture.

projects.title: Bike Sharing Demand Prediction
projects.description: Built a predictive model using AutoGluon to forecast bike-sharing demand. Optimized for RMSLE scores by training on tabular datasets.

projects.title: Sentiment Analysis Web App
projects.description: Deployed a PyTorch-based RNN model on Amazon SageMaker to analyze movie review sentiment, accessible via a public API Gateway endpoint.

projects.title: Chronic Disease Risk Prediction
projects.description: Engineered a Healthy Eating Index (HEI) feature from NHANES data. Developed a reusable Python package to compute HEI scores for predictive modeling.

projects.title: Euromove PWA
projects.description: Serverless Progressive Web App (PWA) on AWS (Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway) for a moving company, reducing paper costs by 70%.

projects.title: Forest Fire Prediction
projects.description: Early warning system for forest fires in Uttarakhand, India. Preprocessed burnt area satellite data using 'firedpy' and conducted model exploration.
